授業目的: 本講義の目的は、学生が主体的に、古代から現代に至る日本の伝統芸能の歴史や特徴を学ぶとともに、芸能が果たした文化史の面での意義や社会的な役割についても考察する。
到達目標: The students will gain a comprehensive knowledge of Japanese traditional performance culture and deepen their understanding of both the historical and social factors that formed the various performing art forms and the intricate workings of power, cultural representation, and gender.
授業方法: Online format:Simultaneous and two-way. The course combines lecture/discussion format with extensive audio-visual display.

第2回: Sources of Japanese theatre I: origins, history, early performing art forms - bugaku; folk performing arts
第3回: Sources of Japanese theatre II: origins, history, early performing art forms - kagura; folk performing arts, their relation to current epidemic
第4回: Noh theatre: history and development, audiences
第5回: Noh theatre: elements of performance, types of plays
第6回: Kyogen comedy: types of kyogen, elements of performance, stories
第7回: Screening of a noh play and a kyogen play, discussion
第8回:
Edo-period performing arts: genres and their social context.
Meiji period: theatre politics and new genres.
第9回: Kabuki: actor’s theatre, stage conventions, audiences
第10回: Kabuki: types of plays, elements of performance, gender presentation - onnagata's body
第12回: Bunraku puppet theatre: history and performance
第13回: Bunraku puppet theatre: the texts. Battles and love suicides. Screening of bunraku plays.
第14回: Women in Japanese performing arts: historical overview. Female versions of all-male performing arts. Geisha performance. The all-female Takarazuka Review.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are expected to complete reading assignments on time to prepare for classes.  Attendance is mandatory.
